metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10933 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in libssh's server-side state machine before versions 0.7.6 and 0.8.4. A malicious client could create channels without first performing authentication, resulting in unauthorized access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh-4 - 0.6.3-4.3ubuntu0.1
libssh-gcrypt-4 - 0.6.3-4.3ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libssh package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.3-4.3ubuntu0.1').
